data.title: Libri dall’Egitto: la biblioteca privata del patriarca siro-ortodosso Ignazio bar Shayallah (1483–1493)
data.abstractNote: Before he was elected as the patriarch of the Syrian Orthodox Church (1483-1492), the monk Yuḥanon bar Shay Allah went to Egypt to refine his culture, especially in the philosophical field. In his biography found in MS Cambridge, University Library, DD.3.8 (1)), there is a list of books that Bar Shay Allah brought from Egypt to his homeland, the region of Tur Abdin (today’s south-eastern Turkey). This article attempts to reconstruct the vicissitudes of this library and to trace at least some books still existing in libraries, like the Medicea Laurenziana Library in Florence.
data.bookTitle: Ancient Egypt and the Surrounding World: Contact, Trade and Influence. Studies Presented to Marilina Betrò
